intro: Fimbristylis exilis var. brachyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flat sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is native to parts of Australia and is often found in swampy or marshy areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
